main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported in the vicinity of Sandberg Pass, California in 1949. Witnesses included trained pilots and military personnel.
interesting points: The objects were described as sausage-shaped, with both forward and trailing ends resembling a B-29 nose.
The objects made unusual maneuvers, including a 360° turn and a 180° turn at high speeds, before disappearing from view.
No definite color or luminosity was observed in the objects, and no radar sightings were reported.
Weather conditions at the time of the sightings included thin scattered clouds, good visibility, and a light southerly wind.
Efforts were made to obtain detailed signed statements from witnesses and to investigate the possibility of jet aircraft flights in the area, but no concurrences were reported.
sighted object: unidentified aerial phenomena reported as sausage-shaped objects
photographs: no photographs included in the reports
